conbody.p:
Jython Evaluatorscripting objectsscripting objectsJython EvaluatorYou can use the following scripting objects in the Jython Evaluator:
records array An array of records to process. The records object should include different elements based on the processing mode that you use:
Record by Record - The records array should include one record element.
Batch by Batch - The records array should include all records in the batch.
record An object that represents a single record. Includes a single value element. The value element contains the data for the record. Map and list record fields are mapped to to Jython lists and dictionaries, respectively.
Data types are preserved for values that are not modified. For values that are modified, the scripting engine might change the original type. For example, for Java 7 JavaScript, modifying an Integer value converts it to a Double. -- Is there a Jython example for this?
out An object that writes the record to the output batch. Includes a write(records) element.
err An object that passes error records to the processor for error handling. Includes a write(records) element with an error message parameter.
